Detailed Description

The result of a service verify request executed by the Bluetooth Stack is an object of the class BtServiceVerifyResult. This class is a collection of zero or more service records. The interface to these service records is built by the class BtSvrServiceRecord.A service record can be seen as a collection of zero or more service attributes. Service attributes are realized in the class BtSvrServiceAttribute. The interface of this class enables the access to the properties of a service attribute like its identifier or its value. The value of such a service attribute is represented by a data element.
A data elements is a description of a concrete value. The type of value a data element contains is descriped by the BtDataElementType that is an enumeration type. As data types in real programming languages data elements can be devided into two kinds of data: atomic and compound data types. Atomic data elements contain one value and the type specifies how to interpret the data pointer.Compound data elements consist themselfs of a sequence of data elements. These data elements can be atomic or compound data elements again. So it is possible to build up recursive structurse of data values.
One particular data element is represented by a BtSvrDataElement object that contains the description of that data element. In this context the expression "description" stands for the size of the data element and a pointer into the memory block of the corresponding BtServieVerifyResult, where this data element starts.
There is no direct access to the memory block and its size. Instead of this there are functions defined to get access to either the data element value and its size (to interpret the returned data pointer correctly) or to the sub data elements of this data element.
The functions for retrieving sub data elements do not copy any data. They only store a description of the sub data element in the passed in BtSvrDataElement. So the application programmer has to provide the memory for the storage of the sub data element.

BOOLEAN BtSvrDataElement::GetDataElementAtIndex (  UINT16  index,
BtSvrDataElement &  svr_data_element
)  const
 

Retrieve a sub data element from this data element.

GetDataElementAtIndex returns the sub data element at the position index of this data element. The index is zero based [0..numberOfDataElements - 1].

Parameters:
index An UINT16 containing the index of the BtSvrDataElement that should be retrieved.
svr_data_element A reference to a BtSvrDataElement where to store the information of the retrieved data element.
Returns:
TRUE: The index is valid and a description of the data element is stored in svr_data_element.
FALSE: The index is out of bounds. Do not use the content of svr_data_element because it is not valid.

UINT16 BtSvrDataElement::GetNumberOfDataElements (   )  const
 

Get number of sub data elements.

GetNumberOfDataElements returns the number of sub data elements contained in this data element.

Returns:
An UINT16 containing the number of sub data elements that are stored in this data element.

BtDataElementType BtSvrDataElement::GetType (   )  const
 

Get the type of this data element.

GetType returns the type of the data element as an enumeration type. In conjunction with the size the C/C++ cast can be determined to interpret the value pointer properly.

Returns:
A BtDataElementType that is an enumeration type describing the type of date element.

const void * BtSvrDataElement::GetValuePointer (   )  const
 

Get a pointer to the concrete value data.

GetValuePointer returns a pointer to the beginning of a memory block containing the value data for this data element. To get full access to the value the returned pointer must be casted to the apropriate C/C++ type or structure.

Returns:
A pointer to void containing the start address of the concrete value data.

INT32 BtSvrDataElement::GetValueSize (   )  const
 

Get the size of the concrete value data.

GetValueSize returns the size of the value data stored in this data element. In conjunction with the type the C/C++ cast can be determined to interpret the value pointer properly.

Returns:
An UINT32 describing the size of the data element value of this data element.

BOOLEAN BtSvrDataElement::IsValid (   )  const
 

Get validity of this data element.

IsValid returns the validity state of this data element.

Returns:
TRUE: This data element is valid. All other member functions return a result that can be used further.
FALSE: This data element is invalid. Do not call any further member functions because they allways will return an error.
